name: It's All in the Title Quiz | Bible: Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: After God cast Lucifer out of Heaven, what was the title given to this wayward angel according to the book of Isaiah?
questions.explanation:
Fallen angel.

	Lucifer was an angel of God that turned away from his Father and was cast down to Earth by God. After this action, Lucifer became known as the fallen angel. His title can be found in the King James Version of Isaiah 14:12.

questions.text: God created Eve from Adam's rib. She was the first woman and Adam gave her the title, "mother of all living".
questions.explanation:
True.

	In the King James Version of Genesis 3:20, Adam named the woman Eve and gave her the title of "mother of all living".

questions.text: Which king was known as "the wise king"?
questions.explanation:
Solomon.

	In the King James version of I Kings 3:5-15, Solomon prayed to God for wisdom. Because Solomon didn't ask for wealth or a long life, God granted him this wisdom along with a discerning heart. God also granted him wealth and honor to make him greater than any man that came before him and any man that would come after him.

questions.text: God gave Abraham the title of "father of ____ nations". What is the missing word?
questions.explanation:
many.

	God not only gave Abram the new name of Abraham in the King James Version of Genesis 17:5, but he gave him the title of "father of many nations". Along with the new name and title, God promised Abraham that he would have many kings come out of his line.

questions.text: Which disciple among Jesus' twelve was known as "the doubter"?
questions.explanation:
Thomas.

	In John 20:24-29 of the King James Version of the Bible, Thomas, a disciple of Jesus, doubts that Jesus rose from the grave until He appears to Thomas and shows him the wounds on His hands and side. Once Thomas touched the wounds of Jesus, he believed.

questions.text: The title "whom Jesus loved" belonged to whom?
questions.explanation:
John.

	John is referred to as the disciple "whom Jesus loved" in the King James Version of John 20:2.

questions.text: Judas Iscariot was known as one of Jesus' twelve disciples until the fateful night that Jesus was taken by the soldiers to be tried and crucified. What title was Judas given after that?
questions.explanation:
The betrayer.

	Judas is known as the betrayer in the King James Version of Matthew 26:48, when he tells the soldiers which man to take into custody by planting a kiss on the man's cheek.

questions.text: Jeremiah was a major prophet in the Bible. What title does the King James Version of Jeremiah 9:1 refer to the prophet as?
questions.explanation:
Weeping.

	Jeremiah was known as "the weeping prophet" because of the constant state of sadness he was in due to his people's disrespect and stubborn ways when it came to God.

questions.text: This man was known in the King James Version of Genesis 5 as the man who walked with God. What was his name?
questions.explanation:
Enoch.

	Enoch was three hundred years old when his son Methusaleh was born. After the birth, Enoch walked with God another sixty-five years before God took him to Heaven.

questions.text: Who did John refer to as "the Lamb of God" in the King James Version of John 1:29?
questions.explanation:
Jesus.

	John was at the Jordan River baptizing people when he was referred to as the Messiah. John denied being the Messiah and spoke of a person that no one was better than. The next day, Jesus showed up to see John. Seeing Jesus, John spoke up to the crowd that the lamb of God was coming. Andrew, a spectator at the baptisms, went to get his brother Simon Peter so they could follow Jesus.
